intro: Galium stellatum, commonly known as starworts, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its whorled arrangement of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and branching. Galium stellatum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
